Luke opens up about how work and hobbies overlap in the tech world, especially when your career is in CS and AI. From the challenges of game streaming at home to dreams of a more comfortable theatre gaming setup, the conversation veers into a broader discussion on home theaters, the idea of recreating Linus’ setup for testing, and the real estate challenges of scaling a media company. Also: Falcon Northwest, modular 21:9 displays, and maybe... a gaming jet?

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TWb2P-GGBcU

title: When your hobbies become your career

A new Chinese cable standard, GPMI, promises huge bandwidth and power delivery, up to 192 Gbps and 480W, but does the world need it? Linus and Luke unpack the announcement and debate whether HDMI could ever be dethroned. They dive into why HDMI has remained dominant for so long, and whether GPMI’s capabilities are compelling enough to make an industry-wide shift.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TWb2P-GGBcU

title: Will HDMI ever be replaced?

With Anno 117 (or is it 11:07?) reportedly coming out later this year, Linus and Luke dive into what they’re hoping to see, and not see, in the next chapter of the city-building franchise. From deeper spy mechanics and land-based combat to simply “more of the same, but with love,” it’s a thoughtful look at what makes Anno 1800 so special, and how the next installment could innovate without ruining the magic.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TWb2P-GGBcU
